Description: Painted pottery shabti of Šmʿyt n Imn Inhy with a black lappet-wig(worn), a brown modelled face with black and white eyes, a white body, a green collar and crossed brown hands in relief holding two red hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs on a yellow ground; the back is decorated with a red and yellow representation of a seed-basket beneath a brown yoke with two pendular nw-pots and brown representations of bandaging.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
